means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 罗克地貌名称，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“岩石”(rock)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 罗克地貌名称，来源于中世纪英语atter oke(at the oak)的误分音节
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 罗克职业名称，毛纺工人，或卷线杆制作者，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“卷线杆”(distaff)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"摇动"之意。
means: rock ： 多指猛烈地摇动或摇晃。
sway ： 主要指树枝等的来回摇动。
swing ： 指有规律地前后、上下摆动，也可指不停地转动。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"石，石头"之意。
means: rock ： 普通用词，指构成地表最坚硬部分或突出于周围地面的巨大岩石，也可指石头或石块。
stone ： 普通用词，泛指井然的或经加工的各类石头，可大可小。
gravel ： 集合名词，常指用于铺路的小石子和沙砾。
pebble ： 多指海边、河边或沙中圆形的小卵石。

word_mean: 组成地壳的天然矿物集合体。
孤立突出于海底的岩石或珊瑚遗体，船舶航行最危险的天然障碍物。

sentence.Network_en: Changing stresses bring about more cracking and rock deformation.

phrase.cizu_name: on the rocks informal 非正式

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a relationship or enterprise) experiencing difficulties and likely to fail
jx.jx_cn_mean: （关系）濒于破裂的；濒临毁灭的；完蛋；（企业）遇经济困难的；（濒于）破产的

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a drink) served undiluted and with ice cubes

jx.jx_en_mean: Confronted with equally unpleasant alternatives and few or no opportunities to evade or circumvent them.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 面临同样令人不愉快的几乎没有机会逃避或克服的选择

phrase.cizu_name: between a rock and a hard place

jx.jx_en_mean: In a state of difficulty, destruction, or ruin
jx.jx_cn_mean: 处于困难境、濒临毁灭或完蛋地

lj.lj_ly: Their marriage is on the rocks.
Our accountant says the business is on the rocks.
lj.lj_ls: 我们的会计师说生意濒临破产
加冰块的苏格兰威士忌酒

jx.jx_en_mean: To disturb the balance or routine of a situation

lj.lj_ly: He has an easygoing managerial style and won't rock the boat unless absolutely necessary.
lj.lj_ls: 他有一套很随意的经营作风，除非极有必要否则不会改变自己一惯的做法

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French rocque, from medieval Latin rocca, of unknown ultimate origin
late Old English roccian, probably from a Germanic base meaning 'remove, move'; related to Dutch rukken 'jerk, tug' and German rücken 'move'. The noun dates from the early 19th cent

entry.def: Rock is the hard substance which the Earth is made of.

example.ex: The hills above the valley are bare rock...
example.tran: 山谷上方的小山全是光秃秃的石头。

example.ex: A little way below the ridge was an outcrop of rock that made a rough shelter.
example.tran: 山脊下方不远处有一块露出地面的岩石，大致形成了一个掩蔽处。

entry.def: A rock is a large piece of rock that sticks up out of the ground or the sea, or that has broken away from a mountain or a cliff.

example.ex: She sat cross-legged on the rock.
example.tran: 她盘腿坐在那块巨大的岩石上。

example.ex: ...the sound of the sea crashing against the rocks...

entry.def: A rock is a piece of rock that is small enough for you to pick up.

example.ex: She bent down, picked up a rock and threw it into the trees.
example.tran: 她弯腰捡起一块石子，扔进了树丛中。

entry.def: When something rocks or when you rock it, it moves slowly and regularly backwards and forwards or from side to side.

example.ex: His body rocked from side to side with the train...
example.tran: 他的身体随着火车左右摇晃。

example.ex: He stood a few moments, rocking back and forwards on his heels...
example.tran: 他站了一会儿，踮着脚跟前后摇晃。

entry.def: If an explosion or an earthquake rocks a building or an area, it causes the building or area to shake. You can also say that the building or area rocks.

example.ex: Three people were injured yesterday when an explosion rocked one of Britain's best known film studios...
example.tran: 昨天，一起爆炸使得英国最著名的电影制片厂之一发生强烈震动，导致3人受伤。

example.ex: ...a country that's rocked by dozens of earthquakes every year...
example.tran: 每年遭受十几次地震袭击的国家

entry.def: If an event or a piece of news rocks a group or society, it shocks them or makes them feel less secure.

example.ex: His death rocked the fashion business.
example.tran: 他的去世震惊了整个时装界。

example.ex: ...the latest scandal to rock the monarchy...
example.tran: 震惊了整个王国的最新丑闻

entry.def: Rock is loud music with a strong beat that is usually played and sung by a small group of people using instruments such as electric guitars and drums.

example.ex: He once told an interviewer that he didn't even like rock music.
example.tran: 他曾告诉一位采访者，他甚至都不喜欢摇滚乐。

entry.tran: （常在英国海滨城镇销售的）棒形硬糖
entry.def: Rock is a sweet that is made in long, hard sticks and is often sold in towns by the sea in Britain.
If you are caught between a rock and a hard place, you are in a difficult situation where you have to choose between two equally unpleasant courses of action.
If you have an alcoholic drink such as whisky on the rocks, you have it with ice cubes in it.

example.tran: 加冰块的苏格兰威士忌

entry.tran: （婚姻）濒临破裂;（企业等）濒临失败;岌岌可危
entry.def: If something such as a marriage or a business is on the rocks, it is experiencing very severe difficulties and looks likely to end very soon.

example.ex: She confided to her mother six months ago that her marriage was on the rocks...
example.tran: 6个月前，她向母亲透露自己的婚姻已经岌岌可危。

example.ex: Our film industry is on the rocks.
example.tran: 我们的电影业困难重重。

means.word_mean: 1. a lump or mass of hard consolidated mineral matter;
2. material consisting of the aggregate of minerals like those making up the Earth's crust;

sentences.sentence: "stone is abundant in New England and there are many quarries"

means.word_mean: 3. (figurative) someone who is strong and stable and dependable;

sentences.sentence: "he was her rock during the crisis"
"Thou art Peter, and upon this rock I will build my church"--Gospel According to Matthew

means.word_mean: 4. hard stick bright-colored stick candy typically peppermint flavored
5. a genre of popular music originating in the 1950s; a blend of Black rhythm-and-blues with White country-and-western;

sentences.sentence: "rock is a generic term for the range of styles that evolved out of rock'n'roll."

means.word_mean: 1. move back and forth or sideways;

sentences.sentence: "She rocked back and forth on her feet"

means.word_mean: 2. cause to move back and forth;

Sentence.sentence: The closest that Herpin came to resting was to sit in a rocking chair and read a half dozen newspapers.
The rest he got from sitting in a rocking chair
Six 4-H girls worked to clean the 72 foot curbside that was covered with weeds, rocks and trash.
Rock stars now face a new hazard --- voice abuse.
What does last week's announcement say about rock star, Phil Collins
The rock band is going to play here for a month.

sentences.en: To build this tunnel we had to cut through the solid rock.
sentences.cn: 为了修建这条隧道, 我们必须凿开坚硬的岩石。

means.word_mean: 岩块, 石块; 礁; 暗礁

sentences.en: The ship came close to the rocks and then sheered away.
sentences.cn: 这条船驶近岩礁, 然后迅速转向避开。
这里有石块儿崩落的危险。

sentences.en: He lifted the rock without effort.
sentences.cn: 他毫不费力地举起了那块石头。

sentences.en: That boy threw rocks at me.
The trees rocked in the wind.
The movement of the ship rocked us to sleep.
sentences.cn: 船的摇晃使我们进入了梦乡。

sentences.en: His sudden death rocked the village.
sentences.cn: 他的突然死亡震惊了全村。

jushi.english: That boy threw rocks at me.
He steered the boat carefully between the rocks.
jushi.chinese: 他小心翼翼地驾船在礁石之间穿行。

jushi.english: There was danger from falling rocks.
jushi.chinese: 坠落的巨石造成了险情。
